member.name: T:Jaeger.Baggage.BaggageSetter

member.name: M:Jaeger.Baggage.BaggageSetter.SetBaggage(Jaeger.Span,System.String,System.String)

Sets the baggage key:value on the and the corresponding logs. Whether the baggage is set on the span depends on if the key is allowed to be set by this service.
A is returned with the new baggage key:value set if key is valid, else returns the existing on the .

member.name: T:Jaeger.Baggage.DefaultBaggageRestrictionManager
member.summary: is a manager that returns a that allows all baggage.

member.name: T:Jaeger.Baggage.IBaggageRestrictionManager
member.summary: is an interface for a class that manages baggage restrictions for baggage keys. The manager will return a for a specific baggage key which will determine whether the baggage key is allowed for the current service and any other applicable restrictions on the baggage value.

member.name: T:Jaeger.Baggage.IBaggageRestrictionManagerProxy
member.summary: is an interface for a class that fetches baggage restrictions for specific service from a remote source i.e. jaeger-agent.

member.name: T:Jaeger.Baggage.RemoteBaggageRestrictionManager
member.summary: returns a that polls the agent for the latest baggage restrictions.

member.name: M:Jaeger.Baggage.RemoteBaggageRestrictionManager.#ctor(System.String,Jaeger.Baggage.IBaggageRestrictionManagerProxy,Jaeger.Metrics.IMetrics,System.Boolean,System.TimeSpan,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary:
Creates a that fetches from a remote agent and keeps track of for a service.
is only exposed for testing purposes so users can determine when the first call to remote agent is made. Under normal operations, this RemoteBaggageRestrictionManager will start up and asynchronously fetch restrictions. If the user wants to know if restrictions are ready, they can check via isReady().
member.param: Restrictions for this service are kept track of.
Proxy to remote agent.
Metrics for metrics emission.

Determines the startup failure mode of . If is true, will not allow any baggage to be written until baggage restrictions have been retrieved from agent. If is false, will allow any baggage to be written until baggage restrictions have been retrieved from agent.
How often restriction are fetched from remote agent.
Delay before first fetch of restrictions.

member.name: T:Jaeger.Baggage.Restriction
member.summary: determines whether a baggage key is allowed and contains any restrictions on the baggage value.

member.name: F:Jaeger.Constants.DebugIdHeaderKey
member.summary: The name of HTTP header or a carrier key which, if found in the carrier, forces the trace to be sampled as "debug" trace. The value of the header is recorded as the tag on the root span, so that the trace can be found in the UI using this value as a correlation ID.

member.name: M:Jaeger.Metrics.ITimer.DurationTicks(System.Int64)
member.remarks: This is called "durationMicros" in Java but since everything is done via ticks in C# we use this name.

member.name: T:Jaeger.Metrics.NoopMetricsFactory
member.summary: A metrics factory that implements NOOP counters, timers and gauges.

member.name: T:Jaeger.Propagation.B3TextMapCodec
member.summary:
This format is compatible with other Zipkin based trace libraries such as Brave, Wingtips, zipkin-js, etc.
Example usage:
var b3TextMapCodec = new B3TextMapCodec(); tracer = new Tracer.Builder(serviceName) .With...() .RegisterCodec(BuiltinFormats.HttpHeaders, b3TextMapCodec) ...
See Instrumenting a Library

member.name: T:Jaeger.Propagation.IExtractor
member.summary: You should implement this class if you want to add possibility to extract information about SpanContext that is provided in your custom propagation scheme. Otherwise you should probably use built-in or .

member.name: M:Jaeger.Propagation.IExtractor.Extract(System.Object)
member.summary:
Called when is used. It should handle the logic behind extracting propagation-scheme specific information from carrier (e.g. http request headers, amqp message headers, etc.).
This method must not modify the carrier.
All exceptions thrown from this method will be caught and logged on WARN level so that business code execution isn't affected. If possible, catch implementation specific exceptions and log more meaningful information.
member.param: Input that you extract Span information from, usually .
member.returns: or null if carrier doesn't contain tracing information, it is not valid or is incomplete.

member.name: T:Jaeger.Propagation.IInjector
member.summary: You should implement this class if you want to add possibility to inject information about that is passed between services in your custom propagation scheme. Otherwise you should probably use built-in or .

member.name: M:Jaeger.Propagation.IInjector.Inject(Jaeger.SpanContext,System.Object)
member.summary:
Called when is used. It should handle the logic behind injecting propagation scheme specific information into the carrier (e.g. http request headers, amqp message headers, etc.).
All exceptions thrown from this method will be caught and logged on ERROR level so that business code execution isn't affected. If possible, catch implementation specific exceptions and log more meaningful information.
member.param: Span context that should be used to pass trace information with the carrier.
Holder of data that is used to pass tracing information between processes.

member.name: T:Jaeger.Samplers.GuaranteedThroughputSampler
member.summary:
is a that guarantees a throughput by using a and in tandem.
The is used to establish a lowerBound so that every operation is sampled at least once in the time interval defined by the lowerBound.

member.param: The operation name, which is ignored by this sampler.
The traceId on the span.

member.name: T:Jaeger.Samplers.ProbabilisticSampler
member.summary: creates a sampler that randomly samples a certain percentage of traces specified by the samplingRate, in the range between 0.0 and 1.0.

member.name: T:Jaeger.Samplers.RateLimitingSampler
member.summary: creates a sampler that samples at most maxTracesPerSecond. The distribution of sampled traces follows burstiness of the service, i.e. a service with uniformly distributed requests will have those requests sampled uniformly as well, but if requests are bursty, especially sub-second, then a number of sequential requests can be sampled each second.

member.name: M:Jaeger.Samplers.RemoteControlledSampler.UpdateSampler
member.summary: Updates to a new sampler when it is different.

member.summary: Replace with a new instance when parameters are updated.
member.param: Response which contains either a or .

member.name: T:Jaeger.Senders.ThriftSender

member.name: T:Jaeger.Senders.UdpSender
member.summary: JaegerUdpTransport provides an implementation to transport spans over UDP using Compact Thrift. It handles making sure payloads efficiently use the UDP packet size by filling up as much of a UDP message it can before sending.

member.name: M:Jaeger.SpanContext.IsDebugIdContainerOnly
member.summary: Returns true when the instance of the context is only used to return the debug/correlation ID from method. This happens in the situation when "jaeger-debug-id" header is passed in the carrier to the extract method, but the request otherwise has no span context in it. Previously this would've returned null from the extract method, but now it returns a dummy context with only debugId filled in.

member.name: M:Jaeger.SpanContext.WithDebugId(System.String)
member.summary: Create a new dummy as a container for string. This is used when "jaeger-debug-id" header is passed in the request headers and forces the trace to be sampled as debug trace, and the value of header recorded as a span tag to serve as a searchable correlation ID.
member.param: Arbitrary string used as correlation ID
member.returns: New dummy that serves as a container for debugId only.

member.summary: Represents a unique 64bit identifier of a span.

member.name: T:Jaeger.TraceId
member.summary: Represents a unique 128bit identifier of a trace.

member.name: M:Jaeger.Tracer.CloseAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Shuts down the and .

member.name: T:Jaeger.Util.RateLimiter
member.summary:
is a rate limiter based on leaky bucket algorithm, formulated in terms of a credits balance that is replenished every time method is called (tick) by the amount proportional to the time elapsed since the last tick, up to max of creditsPerSecond. A call to takes a cost of an item we want to pay with the balance. If the balance exceeds the cost of the item, the item is "purchased" and the balance reduced, indicated by returned value of true. Otherwise the balance is unchanged and return false.
This can be used to limit a rate of messages emitted by a service by instantiating the Rate Limiter with the max number of messages a service is allowed to emit per second, and calling CheckCredit(1.0) for each message to determine if the message is within the rate limit.
It can also be used to limit the rate of traffic in bytes, by setting creditsPerSecond to desired throughput as bytes/second, and calling with the actual message size.
